search_parameters.q: Neil Young, age, music related skills + abilities + occupations, proficiency in each, and current residence location (city, state)

text_blocks.snippet: As of February 7, 2026, the details regarding Neil Young’s career and background are as follows:

list.snippet: Current Residence: Young and his wife, Daryl Hannah, live in a secluded cottage on a lake in rural Canada. They moved there from the United States in 2020 during the COVID-19 pandemic.

text_blocks.snippet: Young is a multi-instrumentalist and industry professional with varying levels of proficiency and influence across several roles:

table: Master: Inducted twice into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame; known for his distinctive high tenor voice and prolific songwriting across rock, folk, and country.
Expert: Ranked No. 30 on Rolling Stone's "250 Greatest Guitarists of All Time" (2023). Known for both "jagged" electric solos and clawhammer acoustic styles.
High: A staple instrument in his live acoustic sets and on hit albums like Harvest.
Proficient: Frequently performs piano-based ballads like "After the Gold Rush".
Experienced: Directs under the pseudonym Bernard Shakey; works include Rust Never Sleeps (1979) and CSNY/Déjà Vu (2008).
Active: Self-produces much of his catalog and pioneered the Pono high-resolution digital audio service.
Functional: Also plays the banjo, ukulele, and pump organ.

text_blocks.snippet: In February 2026, Young cancelled his scheduled summer European and UK tour with his band, The Chrome Hearts, stating he has "decided to take a break" and that "this is not the time" to be on the road.
